GOD.content: reader of literature hypnotized, paralyzed before suspended perplexity, before secret path of secret, exposed and concealed, jealously guarded: who says what to whom? who asks forgiveness?
GOD.linkedContent: reader of literature hypnotized, paralyzed before suspended perplexity, before secret path of secret, exposed and concealed, jealously guarded: who says what to whom? who asks forgiveness?

LOBL.content: think exteriority from angle of economy of the arrêt: greatest “bound” energy, bandée, tightly gathered around its own limit (Hemmung, Haltung) > immediately disseminated, sand, empty, unloaded, spontaneously: in trance of trans, ghosts, transes, folies du jour (cf. Glas on trépas, trans/partition [Derrida’s referring to Genet crossing national borderlines])
LOBL.linkedContent: think exteriority from angle of economy of the arrêt: greatest “bound” energy, bandée, tightly gathered around its own limit (Hemmung, Haltung) > immediately disseminated, sand, empty, unloaded, spontaneously: in trance of trans, ghosts, transes, folies du jour (cf. Glas on trépas, trans/partition [Derrida’s referring to Genet crossing national borderlines])

SPOM.content: fantastic silhouette, autonomy of Marx’s table, inauguration of exchange-value, goes into trances, levitates, relieved of body like all ghosts, little mad too
SPOM.linkedContent: fantastic silhouette, autonomy of Marx’s table, inauguration of exchange-value, goes into trances, levitates, relieved of body like all ghosts, little mad too

POOF.content: friendship can never elude rhetoric of epitáphios, transfixed celebration of spectrality, at once fervent & caught in petrified cold of its inscription (funeral speech, testamentary fervor of heir)
POOF.linkedContent: friendship can never elude rhetoric of epitáphios, transfixed celebration of spectrality, at once fervent & caught in petrified cold of its inscription (funeral speech, testamentary fervor of heir)

PP.content: written traces don’t belong to phusis, not alive, or belong to Heraclitean phusis, in which truth takes shelter in its crypt (à s’abriter en sa crypte) > “cryptogram” is a pleonasm
PP.linkedContent: written traces don’t belong to phusis, not alive, or belong to Heraclitean phusis, in which truth takes shelter in its crypt (à s’abriter en sa crypte) > “cryptogram” is a pleonasm

PP.content: acc. king, pharmakon hypnotizes life of memory, taking it out of itself (la faisant sortir de soi) by monumentalizing it: médusée (medusad)
PP.linkedContent: acc. king, pharmakon hypnotizes life of memory, taking it out of itself (la faisant sortir de soi) by monumentalizing it: médusée (medusad)

PP.content: eidos, truth, law, epistēmē, dialectics, philosophy: names of the pharmakon that must oppose to pharmakon of Sophists, the bewitching fear of death
PP.linkedContent: eidos, truth, law, epistēmē, dialectics, philosophy: names of the pharmakon that must oppose to pharmakon of Sophists, the bewitching fear of death

PP.content: Socrates must listen to the Laws like they’re a phonic spell
PP.linkedContent: Socrates must listen to the Laws like they’re a phonic spell

ROP.content: psychoanalysis is in principle nonhypnotic, affirms right to resistance to hypnosis (and said resistance’s insurmountability)
ROP.linkedContent: psychoanalysis is in principle nonhypnotic, affirms right to resistance to hypnosis (and said resistance’s insurmountability)

DPi.content: the transition, the trance btwn when Jews have received commandments but have yet to hear the “judgments” > as if they know God’s about to invent DP after uttering “thou shalt not kill,” terrified by this divine word electing them > Moses says, “Do not tremble”
DPi.linkedContent: the transition, the trance btwn when Jews have received commandments but have yet to hear the “judgments” > as if they know God’s about to invent DP after uttering “thou shalt not kill,” terrified by this divine word electing them > Moses says, “Do not tremble”

DPi.content: unheimlich concept of belief: the believer (Glaübiger) who affects to believe is divided in belief, fiction of this simulacrum belongs to belief: skepsis, ēpokhē as believing itself > all economy traffics in act of faith: believing w/out believing, belief haunted by non-belief > quasi-hypnotic, quasi-hallucinatory, spectral, unconscious
DPi.linkedContent: unheimlich concept of belief: the believer (Glaübiger) who affects to believe is divided in belief, fiction of this simulacrum belongs to belief: skepsis, ēpokhē as believing itself > all economy traffics in act of faith: believing w/out believing, belief haunted by non-belief > quasi-hypnotic, quasi-hallucinatory, spectral, unconscious

DPi.content: believing (like cruelty) has no contrary, thus is its own contrary
DPi.linkedContent: believing (like cruelty) has no contrary, thus is its own contrary

REST.content: for Heidegger, in Origin, the abyss (Abgrund) plays itself out like “veiled” destiny (fatum) which transfixes (transit) being
REST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, in Origin, the abyss (Abgrund) plays itself out like “veiled” destiny (fatum) which transfixes (transit) being

+R.content: survival movement, arrêt de mort, final trance, sursaut cambré tenu au mors: says “I” (am dead) or hoc est corpus meum > dominant fish, one that bites best, takes from sea a body of scaly writing, homogenous w/ signatory’s initials
+R.linkedContent: survival movement, arrêt de mort, final trance, sursaut cambré tenu au mors: says “I” (am dead) or hoc est corpus meum > dominant fish, one that bites best, takes from sea a body of scaly writing, homogenous w/ signatory’s initials

CIR.content: trance, anguish, desire of [Derrida’s] reader: intermittent flame, don’t know when the explosion will come
CIR.linkedContent: trance, anguish, desire of [Derrida’s] reader: intermittent flame, don’t know when the explosion will come

CIR.content: I don’t have a fantasy of eradication/expropriation but a virtual, mimicked trance, painful pleasure of obsessive ideo-motor drive
CIR.linkedContent: I don’t have a fantasy of eradication/expropriation but a virtual, mimicked trance, painful pleasure of obsessive ideo-motor drive

SPEC.content: [Freud divided] Freud translating translation into scientific theory: 1) “trans-” inhabit origin on (dès) its very threshold 2) perception as prior to its translation
SPEC.linkedContent: [Freud divided] Freud translating translation into scientific theory: 1) “trans-” inhabit origin on (dès) its very threshold 2) perception as prior to its translation

SPEC.content: speculation [beyond PP], investment made by borrowing, no possibility of amortization, no reconciliation by coins, signs, and their telos—promise more than can provide [formula of love?], insolvent—infinite debt, unpayable, thus beyond debt, violates economy of equivalence (not economy in general)
SPEC.linkedContent: speculation [beyond PP], investment made by borrowing, no possibility of amortization, no reconciliation by coins, signs, and their telos—promise more than can provide [formula of love?], insolvent—infinite debt, unpayable, thus beyond debt, violates economy of equivalence (not economy in general)

SPEC.content: death drive & repetition compulsion suck Freud into abyss of PP, always adding a supplement of abyss beneath his steps (movement of trans-)
SPEC.linkedContent: death drive & repetition compulsion suck Freud into abyss of PP, always adding a supplement of abyss beneath his steps (movement of trans-)

SPEC.content: the démarche (procedure) of Beyond… is one of its objects, effects trans- and speculation
SPEC.linkedContent: the démarche (procedure) of Beyond… is one of its objects, effects trans- and speculation

CHOR.content: lack of place, madness of dance, can also serve as alibi for deserting organized, patient, laborious “feminist” struggle
CHOR.linkedContent: lack of place, madness of dance, can also serve as alibi for deserting organized, patient, laborious “feminist” struggle

CHOR.content: how can one breathe w/out punctuation, w/out multiplicities of rhythm, steps, how can one dance?
CHOR.linkedContent: how can one breathe w/out punctuation, w/out multiplicities of rhythm, steps, how can one dance?
